newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas Exchange lists first futures contract.
newsitem.headline: Caracas Exchange lists first futures contract.

text.p: The Caracas Stock Exchange said Wednesday it had approved the listing of the first futures contract as a step toward the operation of a futures market on the exchange.
The futures contact will operate against the exchange's official stock price index, the exchange said in a release.
The exchange did not say when the futures market would begin to operate.
The futures market is to be operated by the recently-created Options and Futures Chamber (CACOFV).
CACOFV was given the go ahead to start a futures and options market by the Venezuelan Securities Commission (CNV) in March.
It counts some of the country's largest banks among its shareholders including Banco Provincial, Mercantil and Union.
